Joseph Haydn

Die Sieben letzten Worte unseres Erlösers am Kreuze, Hob. XX:1C

1787

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 64' 30"

  • 1. L’Introduzione
  • 2. (1.) Sonata I (Pater, dimitte illis quia nesciunt quid faciunt)
  • 3. (2.) Sonata II (Hodie mecum eris in Paradiso)
  • 4. (3.) Sonata III (Ecce Mulier Filius tuus)
  • 5. (4.) Sonata IV (Deus meus, Deus meus et quid dereliquisti me?)
  • 6. (5.) Sonata V (Sitio)
  • 7. (6.) Sonata VI (Consummatum est)
  • 8. (7.) Sonata VII (In manus tuas Domini, commendo Spirito meum)
  • 9. Il Terremoto

This is an arrangement of a work for orchestra (Hob. XX:1A). Haydn did not create the arrangement himself, although he approved its publication and possibly made revisions beforehand. Haydn made further arrangements for string quartet (Hob. III:50–56 = Hob. XX:1B), and choir and orchestra (Hob. XX:2).

Recommended editions

  • Henle · HN 967 · ed. Ullrich Scheideler
  • Könemann · K 219 · Klavierstücke II · ed. Miklós Dolinszky
